alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 21 at 1:22PM CDT until April 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely Through Early Evening... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS ALONG WITH FURNAS, HARLAN, GOSPER AND PHELPS COUNTIES IN NEBRASKA... * WINDS...From the northwest, sustained 20 to 25 MPH and gusting up to around 35 MPH. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that may result in a fire starting.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
